comment: Took prof. Brasco for motion graphics over the summer. Four projects and he works alongside us for the first 2 so we can see how things are done from the beginning to the end. The last two projects are cool, you have a lot of freedom. Attendance is mandatory unless you have access to adobe aftereffects at home. Great class and awesome professor.
He is very honest, informative and fair.

I've taken a couple classes with Brasco and I always learn more. He gives great feedback, and is super clear on grading criteria. Always ready to help and give feedback. He helped me with projects outside of class as well. 
His critiques are not harsh, but he won't be afraid to let you know if something doesn't work. Very helpful.

He's one of my favorite professors. Extremely kind, sympathetic, and understanding. He clearly has a passion for teaching and genuinely helping students learn, improve, and find happiness in their work. If you haven't taken him, please do. He is seriously great, projects are fun, and he allows a lot of creativity & expression.

He's a great teacher who is very respectful and kind. He gives great feedback to your art and genuinely tries to help each student as much as possible! I would highly recommend this teacher. The projects are fun and the majority of them are creative and he promotes using your own stylized art in them. Overall, a wonderful teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Craig is an absolute gem of this school. I took him online over the summer, so it was very fast paced, but he kept us on track and we learned a ton about digital art tools. Gives really good feedback and advice on your art, and pushes you to the best final product possible. Very understanding if you have issues, and entertaining lectures. Take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Brasco is the coolest and nerdiest professor at KSU! Very knowledgeable and puts a lot of effort into his lectures. He's always available for one on one help and is very patient. Brasco is a pillar of this art school.

He is genuinely one of the nicest professors I've ever had. He is super helpful, doesn't assume that you know how to do certain stuff in Adobe, and always offers tutorials to help. He gives great feedback and direction on projects, and is one of the most calm, collected professors I've had in the art program.

I've taken Brasco for several art classes. He is such a good professor! Is very sympathetic and actually cares for his students. He always offers help when people need it. I definitely recommend taking him.

I am taking Prof Brasco's Electronic Illustration class over the 6-week summer course and I don't want it to end! It's be a lot of fun, he gives amazing feedback and is extremely helpful. I feel a lot more confident in drawing and illustrating, and if you're trying to squeeze in a 2D distribution or a requirement, the summer class works. Take him!!
